summary.long: Job is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: There was a man in the land of Uz whose name was Job. That man was without blame. He was right and good, he feared God, and turned away from sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven sons and three daughters were born to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had 7,000 sheep, 3,000 camels, 1,000 oxen, 500 female donkeys, and many servants. He was the greatest of all the men of the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His sons used to go and make a special supper in each one’s house on a special day. And they would send for their three sisters to eat and drink with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the days of their special supper were over, Job would get up early in the morning and send for them. Then he would give burnt gifts for each of them so that they would be pure. For Job said, “It might be that my sons have sinned and cursed God in their hearts.” Job always did this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a day when the sons of God came to show themselves before the Lord. Satan came with them also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Satan, “Where have you come from?” Satan answered the Lord and said, “From traveling around on the earth and walking around on it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Satan, “Have you thought about My servant Job? For there is no one like him on the earth. He is without blame, a man who is right and good. He honors God with fear and turns away from sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Satan answered the Lord, “Does Job fear God for nothing?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have You not made a wall around him and his house and all that he has, on every side? You have brought good to the work of his hands, and he has received more and more in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But put out Your hand now and touch all that he has. And for sure he will curse You to Your face.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Satan, “See, all that he has is in your power. Only do not put your hand on him.” So Satan went out from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On a day when Job’s sons and daughters were eating and drinking wine in their oldest brother’s house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a man came to Job with news, saying, “The oxen were pulling the plow and the donkeys were eating beside them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Sabeans came and took them. They also killed the servants with the sword. I alone have run away from them to tell you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, another man came and said, “The fire of God fell from heaven and burned up the sheep and the servants and destroyed them. I alone have gotten away to tell you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, another came and said, “The Babylonians divided into three groups and came to fight. They took the camels and killed the servants with the sword. I alone have gotten away to tell you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, another also came and said, “Your sons and daughters were eating and drinking wine in their oldest brother’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And see, a strong wind came from the desert and hit the four corners of the house. It fell on the young people and they are dead. I alone have gotten away to tell you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job stood up and tore his clothing and cut the hair from his head. And he fell to the ground and worshiped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Without clothing I was born from my mother, and without clothing I will return. The Lord gave and the Lord has taken away. Praise the name of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all this Job did not sin or blame God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again there was a day when the sons of God came to show themselves before the Lord. And Satan came with them also to show himself before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Satan, “Where have you come from?” Satan answered the Lord and said, “From traveling around the earth and walking around on it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Satan, “Have you thought about My servant Job? For there is no one like him on the earth. He is without blame, a man who is right and good. He fears God and turns away from sin. He still holds to his good ways, even when I allowed you to go against him, and to destroy him for no reason.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Satan answered the Lord and said, “Skin for skin! Yes, all that a man has he will give for his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Put out Your hand now and touch his bone and his flesh, and he will curse You to Your face.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord said to Satan, “See, he is in your power. Only do not kill him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Satan went out from the Lord. And he made very bad sores come on Job from the bottom of his foot to the top of his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Job took a piece of a broken pot to try to cut off the sores while he sat among the ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his wife said to him, “Do you still hold on to your faith? Curse God and die!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to her, “You speak as one of the foolish women would speak. Should we receive good from God and not receive trouble?” In all this Job did not sin with his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Job’s three friends heard of all this trouble that had come upon him, they came each from his own place. They were Eliphaz the Temanite, Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite. They agreed to meet together to come to share Job’s sorrow and comfort him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they looked up from far away and saw how different he looked, they cried in loud voices. They tore their clothing and threw dust over their heads toward the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they sat down on the ground with him for seven days and seven nights. No one said a word to him, for they saw that his suffering was very bad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this Job opened his mouth and cursed the day he was born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let the day be lost on which I was born, and the night which said, ‘A boy is born.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May that day be darkness. May God above not care for it. May light not shine on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let darkness and a heavy shadow take it for their own. Let a cloud come upon it. Let the darkness of the day bring fear upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for that night, let darkness take hold of it. Let it not have joy among the days of the year. Let it not come into the number of months.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, let that night be alone and empty. Let no sound of joy come into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let those curse it who curse the day, who are able to wake up the Leviathan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the early morning stars be made dark. Let it wait for light but have none. Do not let it see the light of day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because it did not keep my mother from giving birth to me, or hide trouble from my eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why did I not die at birth? Why did I not come from my mother and die?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why did the knees receive me, or why the breasts, that I should have milk?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For now I would have lain down and been quiet. I would have slept then. I would have been at rest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with kings and wise men of the earth who built cities for themselves that are now destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I would have been at rest with princes who had gold, who filled their houses with silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why did I not die before I was born, hidden and put away, as babies that never see the light?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There the troubles of the sinful stop. There the tired are at rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those in prison are at rest together. They do not hear the voice of the one who rules over their work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The small and the great are there. And the servant is free from his owner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why is light given to him who suffers? Why is life given to those who feel sad in their soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They wait for death, but there is none. They dig for it more than for hidden riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are filled with much joy and are glad, when they find the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why is light given to a man whose way is hidden, and around whom God has built a wall?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I cry inside myself in front of my food. My cries pour out like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What I was afraid of has come upon me. What filled me with fear has happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am not at rest, and I am not quiet. I have no rest, but only trouble.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If one speaks with you, will you want him to stop? But who can keep from speaking?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, you have taught many, and you have given strength to weak hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your words have helped him stand who would have fallen. You have given strength to weak knees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now it has come to you, and you are not happy. It touches you, and you are troubled and sad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not your fear of God what gives you strength and your good ways that give you hope?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Think now, who without guilt was ever destroyed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As I have seen, those who plow sin and plant trouble gather the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By the breath of God they are destroyed. They are destroyed by the wind of His anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The noise of the lion, the voice of the angry lion, and the teeth of the young lions are broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The strong lion dies because there is no food to get. And the young of the lioness are sent everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now a word was brought to me in secret. My ear heard it spoken in a quiet voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With troubled thoughts from the dreams of the night, when deep sleep comes upon men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: fear came to me and I shook. It made all my bones shake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A spirit passed by my face. The hair of my flesh stood up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The spirit stood still, but I could not understand what I saw. Something was in front of my eyes. All was quiet, then I heard a voice:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Can man be right more than God? Can a man be pure more than his Maker?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He puts no trust even in His servants. He finds mistakes among His angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How much more those who live in houses of clay, who build upon the dust, who are crushed like the moth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Between morning and evening they are destroyed. Without anyone seeing it they become lost forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not their tent-rope pulled up within them? They die, and have no wisdom.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Call now. Is there anyone who will answer you? To which of the holy ones will you turn?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To be bitter kills the foolish man, and jealousy kills the child-like.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have seen the fool taking root, but right away his house was cursed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His sons are far from being safe. They are destroyed in the gate, and there is no one to help them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hungry eat the food of his field. They take it even out of the thorns. And the thirsty want his riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For suffering does not come from the dust. Trouble does not grow out of the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But man is born to trouble, as fire goes up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But as for me, I would look to God. I would put my troubles before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He does great things, too great for us to understand. He does too many wonderful things for us to number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gives rain on the earth and sends water on the fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He puts those who are in low places up to high places. Those who are filled with sorrow are lifted to where they are safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He troubles the plans of those who try to fool people, so that their hands cannot do what they plan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God gets them into a trap when they use their own wisdom. And the plans of the wise are brought to a quick end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They meet with darkness during the day, and feel their way at noon as in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He saves from the sword those in need. He saves the poor from the power of the strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So those who have no hope, have hope, and what is not right and good must shut its mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, happy is the man to whom God speaks strong words. So do not hate the strong teaching of the All-powerful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He punishes, but He gives comfort. He hurts, but His hands heal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will take you out of six troubles. Yes, in seven, nothing will hurt you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will keep you from death in times of no food, and from the power of the sword in war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be hidden from the punishment of the tongue. You will not be afraid of being destroyed when danger comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will laugh at danger and times of no food. And you will not be afraid of wild animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you will be in agreement with the stones of the field. And the animals of the field will be at peace with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will know that your tent is safe. You will look over what you have and see that nothing is gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will know also that your children and children’s children will be many. They will be as the grass of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will come to the grave in full strength, like the grain gathered in when it is time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, this is what we have found, and it is true. Hear it, and know for yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If only my trials and troubles were weighed!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They would weigh more than the sand of the seas. My words have been spoken fast and without thought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the arrows of the All-powerful are in me. My spirit drinks their poison. The hard things from God are like an army against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does the wild donkey make noise when it has grass? Or does the bull make noise when it has food?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can something that has no taste be eaten without salt? Is there any taste in the white of an egg?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My soul will not touch them. They are like hated food to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If only I might get what I ask for, and that God would give me what I desire!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If only God were willing to crush me, that He would let His hand loose and destroy me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this gives me comfort even though I suffer much pain because I have not turned away from the words of the Holy One.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What strength have I, that I should wait? What is my end, that I should not give up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do I have the strength of stones? Is my flesh brass?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have no power to help myself, and a way out is far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Kindness from a friend should be shown to a man without hope, or he might turn away from the fear of the All-powerful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My brothers have been like rivers that are not there when needed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are dark because of ice and snow turning into water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they have no water, there is no noise. When it is hot, they are not there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people on their camels turn away from them. They go into the waste places and die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people and camels of Tema looked. The travelers of Sheba hoped for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were troubled for they had trusted. They came there and their hope goes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, this is how you have been. You see my trouble and are afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have I said, ‘Give me something,’ or, ‘Pay something from your riches to help me’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have I said, ‘Take me out from under the power of the one who hates me,’ or, ‘Save me from those who make it hard for me’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teach me, and I will be quiet. Show me where I have been wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Honest words give pain. But what does your arguing prove?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you think you can speak against my words, and act as if the words of a man without hope are wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You would even draw names over those who have no father, and make trades over your friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now be pleased to look at me, and see if I lie to your face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I ask that you change your minds and let no wrong be done. Stop now, for I am still right and good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is there wrong-doing on my tongue? Can I not taste trouble?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Is not man made to work on earth? Are not his days like the days of a man paid to work?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like a servant who desires to be out of the sun, and like a working man who waits for his pay,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am given months of pain and nights of suffering for no reason.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I lie down I say, ‘When will I get up?’ But the night is long, and I am always turning from side to side until morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My flesh is covered with worms and dirt. My skin becomes hard and breaks open.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My days are faster than a cloth-maker’s tool, and come to their end without hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Remember that my life is only a breath. My eye will not again see good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eye of him who sees me will see me no more. Your eyes will be on me, but I will be gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a cloud goes away, it is gone. And he who goes down to the place of the dead does not come back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will not return to his house, and his place will not know him any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So I will not keep my mouth shut. I will speak in the suffering of my spirit. I will complain because my soul is bitter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Am I the sea, or a large sea animal, that You put someone to watch me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I say, ‘My bed will comfort me, and there I will find rest from my complaining,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then You send dreams to me which fill me with fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So a quick death by having my breath stopped would be better to me than my pains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I hate my life. I will not live forever. Leave me alone, for my days are only a breath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is man, that You make so much of him? Why do You care about him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that You look at him every morning, and test him all the time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How long will it be until You look away from me? Will You not let me alone until I swallow my spit?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have I sinned? What have I done to You, O watcher of men? Why have you made me something to shoot at, so that I am a problem to myself?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why then do You not forgive my wrong-doing and take away my sin? For now I will lie down in the dust. You will look for me, but I will not be.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Bildad the Shuhite answered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How long will you say these things, and the words of your mouth be a strong wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does God make wrong what is fair? Does the All-powerful make wrong what is right?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your children have sinned against Him, He has given them over to the power of their sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you will look for God and pray to the All-powerful,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if you are pure and right and good, for sure He will help you. Because you are right and good He will put you back where you should be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And even if your beginning was small, your end will be very great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Ask about those who have lived before. Think about what their fathers learned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are only of yesterday and know nothing. Our days on earth are as a shadow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will they not teach you and tell you, and speak words of wisdom?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Can the tall river grass grow up from dry ground? Can the grass that grows in wet places grow without water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While it is still green and not cut, it becomes dry and dead before any other plant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So are the ways of all who forget God. The hope of the man without God is destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What he trusts in is easy to break, like the home of a spider.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The spider trusts in his house, but it falls apart. He holds on to it, but it does not hold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is full of strength in the sunshine, and his branches spread out over his garden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His roots grow around rocks and they work their way among the stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he is taken from his place, then it will turn away from him, saying, ‘I have never seen you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, this is the joy of His way. And out of the dust others will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, God will not turn away from a man who is honest and faithful. And He will not help those who do wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will yet make you laugh and call out with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who hate you will be dressed with shame. And the tent of the sinful will be no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yes, I know this is true. But how can a man be right and good before God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If one wished to argue with Him, he would not be able to answer one out of a thousand of His questions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is wise in heart and powerful in strength. Who has ever stood against Him without being hurt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is He Who takes away the mountains without their knowing it, when He destroys them in His anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shakes the earth out of its place, and its pillars shake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He tells the sun not to shine, and He keeps the stars from shining.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He alone spreads out the heavens and walks upon the waves of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He makes the Bear, Orion and the Pleiades and the stars of the south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He does things too great for us to understand, and more wonderful works than we can number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He passes by me, I do not see Him. When He goes by me, I do not know Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If He takes away, who can stop Him? Who could say to Him, ‘What are You doing?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “God will not stop His anger. The helpers of Rahab bow under Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How then can I answer Him, and choose the right words to speak with Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if I am right, I cannot answer Him. I must beg Him who is against me to have pity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I called and He answered me, I could not believe that He was listening to my voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He crushes me with a storm, and hurts me more and more without a reason.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will not let me get my breath, but fills me with much that is bitter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it is a question of power, see, He is the strong one! If it is a question of what is right and fair, who can call Him to a trial?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if I were right, my mouth would say that I am guilty. Even if I were without blame, He would say I am guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even though I am without blame, I do not care about myself. I hate my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is all the same, so I say, ‘He destroys both those who are without blame and the sinful.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If death comes fast by disease, He makes fun of the trouble of those who have done no wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth is given into the hand of the sinful. He covers the faces of its judges. If it is not He, then who is it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My days go faster than a runner. They fly away, and see no good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They go by like fast boats, like an eagle coming down to catch its food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I say, ‘I will forget my complaining. I will put off my sad face and be happy,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am still afraid of all my pains for I know You will not take away my guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because I am already guilty, why should I try for nothing?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I wash myself with snow and clean my hands using the best soap,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You would still throw me down into a deep hole. And my own clothes would hate me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He is not a man, as I am, that I may answer Him, that we might go to trial together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no one to decide between us, who might lay his hand upon us both.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let Him stop punishing me. And do not let fear of Him make me so afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I would speak and not be afraid of Him. But I am not like that in myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I hate my life. I will be free in my complaining. I will show how bitter I am in my soul when I speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will say to God, ‘Do not say that I am guilty and punish me. Let me know why You work against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do You think it is right for You to make it hard for me, to turn away from the work of Your hands and favor the plans of the sinful?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do You have eyes of flesh? Do You see as a man sees?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are Your days as the days of man, or Your years as man’s years,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that You should look for my wrong-doing and my sin?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know that I am not guilty, yet there is no one who can take me away from Your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Your hands put me together and made me, and now would You destroy me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember that You have made me as clay. Would You turn me into dust again?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did You not pour me out like milk and make me become hard like cheese?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have given me clothing of skin and flesh, and have tied me together with bones and cord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have given me life and loving-kindness. Your care has kept my spirit alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet You have hidden these things in Your heart. I know that this is in Your thoughts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I sin, You would see me, and would not free me from my guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I am sinful, it would be bad for me! If I am right and good, I cannot lift my head for I am filled with shame and see all my trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I would lift up my head, You would hunt me like a lion. Again You would show Your power against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You would send new ones who would speak against me, and become more angry with me. You would send me more and more trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Why then did You let me be born? If only I had died and no one had seen me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I should have been as if I had never lived, carried from my mother to the grave.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are not my days few? Leave me alone, that I may find a little comfort
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: before I go to a place from which I will not return. I will go to the land of darkness and shadow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is the land of complete darkness and shadow and trouble, where the light is darkness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zophar the Naamathite answered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Should many words go without an answer? Should a man full of talk be said to be without blame?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should your words of pride make men quiet? Should you make fun of truth and no one speak sharp words to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you say, ‘What I believe is pure. I am without fault in Your eyes.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If only God would speak, and open His lips against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He would show you the secrets of wisdom because there are two sides. Then you would know that God is punishing you less than you should get.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Can you find out the deep things of God? Can you find out how far the All-powerful can go?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are higher than the heavens. What can you do? They are deeper than the place of the dead. What can you know?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are longer than the earth and wider than the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If He passes by, puts a man in prison, or calls him to trial, who can stop Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He knows men who are no good. When He sees wrong-doing, will He not look into it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A fool cannot become wise anymore than a wild donkey can give birth to a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you set your heart right, and put out your hands to Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if you put away the sin that is in your hand, do not let wrong-doing be in your tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will be able to lift up your face without sin. You would be strong and not afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you would forget your trouble, remembering it as waters that have passed by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your life would be brighter than noon. Darkness would be like the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you would trust, because there is hope. You would look around and rest and be safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You would lie down and no one would make you afraid. Many would ask for your favor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the eyes of the sinful will waste away. There will be no way for them to get away. And their hope is to breathe their last.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No doubt you are the people, and wisdom will die with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have understanding as well as you. I am not less than you. Who does not know such things as these?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even my friends laugh at me. The man who called on God, and God answered him, the man who is right and without blame is laughed at.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who lives in comfort laughs at one who has trouble and whose feet are slipping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tents of those who destroy have much. Those who make God angry are safe and have their god in their own hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But ask the wild animals, and they will teach you. Ask the birds of the heavens, and let them tell you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or speak to the earth, and let it teach you. Let the fish of the sea make it known to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who among all these does not know that the hand of the Lord has done this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In His hand is the life of every living thing and the breath of all men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does not the ear test words as the mouth tastes food?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wisdom is with old men, and understanding with long life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “With God are wisdom and strength. Wise words and understanding belong to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, He tears down, and it cannot be built again. He puts a man in prison, and no one can free him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, He stops the waters and they dry up. He sends them out, and they cover the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Strength and wisdom are with Him. Both the fool and the one who fools him belong to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He takes wisdom away from leaders and makes fools of judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He takes off chains put on by kings, and holds back the power of kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He makes religious leaders walk without pride, and takes the power away from those who think they are safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He stops the trusted ones from speaking and takes away the wisdom of the leaders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He pours anger on rulers, and takes away the strength of the strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He makes known hidden truth from the darkness, and brings deep darkness to light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He makes the nations great, and then destroys them. He helps nations to become large, then leads them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He takes away understanding from the leaders of the people of the earth, and makes them travel in a waste-land with no path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They feel their way in darkness with no light. And He makes them walk from side to side like a drunk man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, my eye has seen all this. My ear has heard and understood it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What you know I also know. I am not less than you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But I wish to speak to the All-powerful. I want to argue with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you cover things with lies. You are doctors of no worth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If only you would be quiet, and that would show your wisdom!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear what I think. Listen to the arguing of my lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will you say what is not true for God? Will you lie for Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will you show favor for Him? Will you argue for God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will it be well when He tests you? Or do you lie to Him as one lies to a man?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure He will speak strong words to you if you show favor in secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will not His great power make you afraid? Will not the fear of Him come upon you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your wise sayings are sayings of ashes. Your strength is the strength of clay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be quiet so that I may speak. Then let come on me what will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why should I take my flesh in my teeth, and put my life in my hands?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even though He would kill me, yet I will trust in Him. I will argue my ways to His face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This will save me, for a sinful man may not come to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful to listen to my words. Let what I say fill your ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I am ready to tell everything, and all will know I am right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who will talk against me? For then I would be quiet and die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Only two things I ask of You, and then I will not hide from Your face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take Your hand from me, and do not let the fear of You make me so afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then call, and I will answer. Or let me speak, and You answer me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How many are my sins and wrong-doings? Help me to know my wrong-doing and sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do You hide Your face, and think of me as one who hates You?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will You make a wind-blown leaf afraid? Will You go after the dry parts of a grain-field that have no worth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For You write bitter things against me. You punish me for the sins I did when I was young.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You put chains on my feet, and watch everything I do. You let me walk only so far.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am wasting away like a piece of dead wood, like clothing eaten by the moth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Man who is born of woman lives only a short time and is full of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He grows up and dries like a flower. He leaves like a shadow and does not stay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You open Your eyes on him and decide about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who can make clean what is unclean? No one!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man’s days are numbered. You know the number of his months. He cannot live longer than the time You have set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now look away from him that he may rest, until he has lived the time set for him like a man paid to work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For there is hope for a tree, when it is cut down, that it will grow again, and that its branches will not stop growing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its roots grow old in the ground, and the base of the tree dies in the dry ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But with water it will grow. Branches will grow from it like a plant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But man dies and is laid low. Man dies, and where is he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As water goes into the air from the sea, and the river wastes away and dries up,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so man lies down and does not get up again. Until the heavens are no more, he will not wake up or come out of his sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If only You would hide me in the place of the dead! If only You would hide me until Your anger is past, and set a time for me and remember me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man dies, will he live again? I will wait all the days of my trouble until a change comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will call and I will answer You. You will wait for the work of Your hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For now You number my steps. You do not write down my sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My sin is locked up in a bag. You cover my wrong-doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the mountain falls and breaks apart to nothing. The rock moves from its place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Water wears away the stones. Its floods wash away the dust of the earth. So You destroy man’s hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have power over him forever, and he leaves. You change what he looks like and send him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His sons receive honor, but he does not know it. Or they lose honor, but he does not see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His body gives him pain, and he has sorrow only for himself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Should a wise man answer with learning that is of no worth, and fill himself with the east wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should he argue with talk that will not help, or with words that do no good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure you are doing away with the fear of the Lord. You are stopping the quiet worship of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You show your sin by what you say. You are trying to hide behind your words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your own mouth says you are guilty, and not I. Your own lips speak against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Were you the first man to be born? Or were you made before the hills?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Were you there to hear the secret plans of God? Are you the only one who has wisdom?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What do you know that we do not know? What do you understand that is not clear to us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men whose hair has grown white and those who have lived many years are among us. They are older than your father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are the gentle words spoken to you, which give comfort from God, too little for you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why does your heart carry you away? And why do your eyes shine,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you turn your spirit against God and let such words go out of your mouth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is man, that he can be pure, or he who is born of a woman, that he can be right and good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, God puts no trust in His holy ones. The heavens are not pure in His eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How much less one who is hated and sinful, a man who drinks sin like water!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will tell you, listen to me. I will make known what I have seen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: what wise men have told that they learned from their fathers. They have not hidden anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the ones to whom the land was given, and no stranger passed among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sinful man suffers in pain all his days. His years are numbered because of all his sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sounds of fear are in his ears. When all seems to be going well, the one who destroys will come upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He does not believe that he will be taken away from darkness, and the sword is meant for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He goes to look for food, saying, ‘Where is it?’ He knows that a day of darkness is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Trouble and pain fill him with fear. They have power over him like a king ready for battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has put out his hand against God, and is full of pride against the All-powerful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He rushes in pride against Him with his big battle-covering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His face is fat, and his thighs are heavy with fat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has lived in cities that have been laid waste, in houses where no one lives which will be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will no longer be rich, and what he has will not last. His grain will come to nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will not get away from darkness. The fire will dry up his branches, and the breath of God’s mouth will drive him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him not lie to himself and trust in what is empty. For what is empty will be his reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be paid in full while he still lives, and his branch will not be green.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be like the vine that drops off its grapes before they are ready. And he will throw off his flower like the olive tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who visit the sinful bring no fruit. And fire destroys the tents of those who do wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They give birth to trouble and bring sin. Their minds plan lies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have heard many such things. All of you bring trouble instead of comfort.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is there no end to your words that are full of wind? What is your problem that you keep on talking?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also could speak like you, if I were in your place. I could put words together against you, and shake my head at you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I could give you strength with my mouth. I could speak words of comfort and make your pain less.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If I speak, my pain is not made less. And if I keep quiet, it does not leave me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now God has taken away my strength. He has taken away all my family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has made me dry up, and this speaks against me. The wasting away of my body rises up against me. It speaks against me to my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His anger has torn me and hated me. He has ground His teeth at me. The one against me looks hard at me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men have looked at me with their mouths open. They have hit me on the face with anger. They have gathered together against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God gives me over to bad men. He throws me into the hands of the sinful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was living in comfort, but He has taken that away. He has taken hold of me by the neck and shaken me to pieces. He has set me up for something to shoot at.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His arrows are all around me. He cuts my kidneys open without pity. He pours the bitter insides on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hurts me again and again. He runs at me like a man of war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have sewed cloth made from hair over my skin, and have laid my hope in the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My face is red from crying, and darkness is over my eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But my hands have done nothing bad, and my prayer is pure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O earth, do not cover my blood. Let my cry have no place to rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, even now there is One Who sees me from heaven. The One Who speaks for me is on high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My friends make fun of me. My eyes pour out tears to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If only a man could give reasons to God, as a man does for his neighbor!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In a few years I will go the way that I cannot return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My spirit is broken. My days are gone. The grave is ready for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure those with me make fun of me. My eyes see how they laugh at me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Promise that You will hear me. Who is there that will trust me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For You have kept their heart from understanding, so You will not honor them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If one speaks against friends to get money, the eyes of his children also will become weak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But He has made me an object of shame to the people. Men spit on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My eyes have become weak with sorrow. All the parts of my body are like a shadow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men who are right and good will be surprised and afraid at this. He who is without guilt will be moved to go against the sinful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who is right with God will hold to his way. And he who has clean hands will become stronger and stronger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all of you try again, and I will not find a wise man among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My days are past. My plans are torn apart, even the wishes of my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They make night into day, saying, ‘The light is near,’ when there is darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I look for the place of the dead as my home, I make my bed in the darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I say to the grave, ‘You are my father,’ and to the worm, ‘My mother and my sister,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then where is my hope? Who sees hope for me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will it go down with me to the place of the dead? Will we go down together into the dust?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Bildad the Shuhite answered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How long will you keep talking? Show understanding and then we can talk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why are we thought of as animals? Why do you see us as not being able to think?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You who tear yourself in your anger, will the earth be left alone because of you? Or will the rocks be moved from their place?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yes, the light of the sinful is put out. His fire does not give light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The light in his tent is made dark, and his lamp goes out above him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His strong steps are made short, and his own plans make him fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he is thrown down into a net by his own feet and walks on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A trap catches him by the foot and holds him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A tied rope is hidden in the ground for him. A trap is set for him on the path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is filled with fear on every side. It follows him at every step.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His strength leaves him because trouble is waiting for him at every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His skin is eaten by disease and the beginning of death eats his legs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is taken away from his tent where he was safe, and is brought to the king of fears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fire destroys everything in his tent and sulphur is spread where he lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His roots are dried below and his branch is cut off above.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one on earth will remember him. His name will not be known in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is sent from light into darkness, and driven away from where people live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has no children among his people to carry on his name where he lived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those in the west are surprised and afraid at what happened to him. And those in the east are filled with fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure, these are the houses of the sinful. This is the place of him who does not know God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How long will you make me suffer and crush me with words?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ten times you have put me to shame and are not ashamed to wrong me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if it is true that I have done wrong, it stays with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You put yourselves up high against me, and try to prove my shame to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will know then that God has wronged me, and has set a trap around me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, I cry, ‘Someone is hurting me!’ but I get no answer. I call for help, but no one stands for what is right and fair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has built a wall in my way so that I cannot pass. And He has put darkness on my paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has taken my honor from me, and taken the crown from my head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He breaks me down on every side, and I am gone. He has pulled up my hope like a tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has made His anger burn against me, and thinks of me as one who fights against Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His armies come together and build a path against me. They camp around my tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He has taken my brothers far away from me and my friends have all left me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My brothers have left me, and my close friends have forgotten me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who live in my house and my women servants think of me as a stranger. I am like one from another country in their eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I call to my servant, but he does not answer. I have to beg him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My breath smells bad to my wife, and I am hated by my own brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even young children hate me. When I get up they speak against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All my friends hate me. Those I love have turned against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am only skin and flesh. And I have gotten away only by the skin of my teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have pity on me. Have pity on me, O you my friends. For the hand of God has hit me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you make it hard for me as God does? Have I not suffered enough to please you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If only my words were written! If only they were written down in a book!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If only they were cut forever into the rock with an iron cutter and lead!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for me, I know that the One Who bought me and made me free from sin lives, and that He will stand upon the earth in the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even after my skin is destroyed, yet in my flesh I will see God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I myself will see Him. With my own eyes I will see Him and not another. My heart becomes weak within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you say, ‘How will we make it hard for him?’ and, ‘The root of the problem is in him,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you should be afraid of the sword for yourselves. For anger is punished by the sword, that you may know there is punishment for wrong-doing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zophar the Naamathite answered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My troubled thoughts make me answer, because I have no rest inside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I heard the strong words that take away my honor. The spirit of my understanding makes me answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not know from long ago, since man was put on earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the honor of the sinful is short, and the joy of the sinful lasts only a short time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if his pride is as high as the heavens and his head touches the clouds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he will be gone forever, like his own waste. Those who have seen him will say, ‘Where is he?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will fly away like a dream, and not be found. He will be driven away like a dream of the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eye which saw him will see him no more. His place will no longer see him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His sons will look for the favor of the poor. And his hands will give back his riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His bones are full of the strength of the young, but it will lie down with him in the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Sin is sweet in his mouth. He hides it under his tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hates to let it go, and holds it in his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet his food in his stomach is changed to the poison of snakes inside him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He eats riches, but will spit them up. God will take them out of his stomach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will drink the poison of snakes. The snake’s tongue will kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will not look at the rivers, the rivers flowing with honey and milk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He must return what he has worked for, and can not eat it. He will not have joy from the riches of his trading.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he has taken from the poor and left them with nothing. He has taken houses which he has not built.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Because he thought he never had enough, he has nothing that gives him joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was nothing more for him to get, so his having everything will not last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even when he has many riches, he will have trouble. Everyone who suffers will come against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he fills his stomach, God will send His great anger on him. He will send it on him while he is eating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He may get away from the iron sword, but the brass bow will shoot an arrow in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It cuts through his body and comes out of his back. The shining arrow comes out of his liver. Much fear comes upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Complete darkness is stored up for his riches. A fire not kept going by man will burn him up. It will destroy all that is left in his tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heavens will make his sin known, and the earth will rise up against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The things of his house will be carried away. They will be taken away in the day of God’s anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what God has for sinful men. It is what God chooses to give to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be careful to listen to my words. Let this be the comfort you give me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen to me while I speak. Then after I have spoken, you may keep on making fun of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for me, am I complaining against man? Why should my spirit not be troubled?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look at me, and be surprised; and put your hand over your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I think, I am troubled; and fear takes hold of my body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do the sinful live, become old, and become very powerful?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They watch their children’s children become strong in front of their eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their houses are safe from fear. And the punishment of God does not come upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their bull mates without trouble. Their cow gives birth to live calves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They send out their little ones like a flock, and their children jump around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They sing to the timbrel and the harp. They show their joy at the sound of the horn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They spend their days with much more than they need. And all at once they go down to the place of the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They say to God, ‘Leave us alone! We do not want to know Your ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is the All-powerful, that we should serve Him? What would we have more than we have if we prayed to Him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, their well-being is not in their own hands. The wisdom of the sinful is far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How many times is the lamp of the sinful put out, that their trouble comes upon them? How often does God send trouble to them in His anger?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are they like straw blown by the wind? Are they like straw that the storm carries away?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You say, ‘God stores up a man’s punishment for his sons.’ Let God punish him so that he may know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let his own eyes see himself being destroyed. Let him drink the anger of the All-powerful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what does he care for his house and family after he is dead, when the number of his months is over?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can anyone teach God anything, when He judges those on high?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One man dies while still very strong, having everything he needs and time to enjoy it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His body has good food and his bones are strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another dies with bitter feelings in his soul, never having enjoyed anything good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Together they lie down in the dust, and worms cover them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, I know your thoughts and your plans to wrong me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you say, ‘Where is the house of the leader? Where are the tents where the sinful men live?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have you not asked those who travel this way? Do you listen to what they say?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the sinful are kept for the day of trouble. They will be brought out on the day of anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who will talk to him about his way to his face? And who will punish him for what he has done?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he is carried to the grave, men will keep watch over his grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth of the valley will be sweet to him. All men will follow after him, and those who go before him are too many to number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How then can you comfort me with foolish words? Your answers are full of lies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Can a man be of use to God? Can a wise man be of use to himself?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is the All-powerful pleased if you are right and good? Is it of any use to Him if your ways were perfect?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it because of how you honor God that He speaks strong words to you and punishes you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have you not done much wrong and your sins have no end?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have taken things from your brothers when they did not owe you anything. You have taken all their clothing and they have had nothing to wear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To those who were tired, you have given no water to drink. And you have kept bread from the hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you were a powerful and respected man owning land and living on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have sent women away with nothing, whose husbands have died. And you have crushed the strength of children who have no parents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So traps are all around you, and much fear comes upon you all at once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is why it is dark and you cannot see, and a flood of water covers you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Is not God high up in heaven? See the highest stars, how high they are!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you say, ‘What does God know? Can He judge through the darkness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Clouds cover Him so that He cannot see. He walks on the roof of heaven.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will you keep to the old way which sinful men have walked?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were taken away before their time. The ground they stood on was washed away by a river.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to God, ‘Leave us!’ and ‘What can the All-powerful do to us?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet He filled their houses with good things. But the wisdom of the sinful is far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who are right and good see it and are glad. Those who are without guilt make fun of them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, ‘For sure those who hate us are destroyed, and fire has destroyed what they owned.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Agree with God, and be at peace with Him. Then good will come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Receive the teaching from His mouth, and keep His words in your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you return to the All-powerful, things will be well with you again. Put sin far from your tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Put your gold in the dust, and gold of Ophir among the stones of the river.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the All-powerful will be your gold and silver of much worth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will have joy in the All-powerful, and lift up your face to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will pray to Him, and He will hear you. And you will keep your promises to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will decide something, and it will be done for you. Light will shine on your path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God puts down the man who is filled with pride. But He saves the one who is not proud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will save the man who is even guilty because he will be helped by your hands that are clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Even today my complaining is bitter. His hand is heavy even when I cry inside myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If only I knew where to find Him, that I might go where He is!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I would tell Him how things are with me, and my mouth would be ready to argue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I would know His answer, and could think about what He would say to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Would He go against me using His great power? No, He would listen to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There a man who is right could reason with Him. And I would be set free by my Judge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, I go east, but He is not there. I go west, but I cannot see Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He works to the left, I cannot see Him. When He turns to the right, I cannot see Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He knows the way that I take. When He has tried me, I will come out as gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My foot has kept close to His steps. I have kept His way and have not turned aside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have not turned away from the words of His lips. I have stored up the words of His mouth. They are worth more to me than the food I need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He cannot be changed. Who can go against Him? He does whatever He wants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He does what He has planned for me, and many such things are in His mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I am afraid to be with Him. When I think about it, I am very afraid of Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God has made my heart weak. The All-powerful has filled me with fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I am not made quiet by the darkness or the deep shadow which covers my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why are times for judging not set up by the All-powerful? And why do those who know Him not see these days?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some take away the land-marks and take fields and animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They drive away the donkeys that belong to those who have no parents. They take the bull that belongs to a woman whose husband has died, as a promise that she will pay what she owes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They push poor people off the road. All the poor of the land are made to hide themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, they go out like wild donkeys in the desert to look for food for their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gather food in the fields, and gather what they can that is left from the grape-fields owned by the sinful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They lie all night without clothing, and have no covering in the cold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are wet with the mountain rains and stay close to the rocks for cover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others take from the breast the child who has no father. They take the child from the poor as a promise that they will pay what they owe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They make the poor go about without clothing, making them carry loads of cut grain while they are hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among the olive trees they make oil. They crush grapes but they are thirsty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men from the city cry inside themselves. The souls of those who are hurt cry out. Yet God does not listen to their prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then there are those who turn against the light. They do not want to know its ways or stay in its paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who kills people gets up early in the morning. He kills the poor and those in need. And during the night he is like a robber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eye of the one who is not faithful in marriage waits for the evening, saying, ‘No one will see me.’ And he covers his face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the dark they dig into houses. They shut themselves up during the day and do not know the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For midnight is morning to them. They are not afraid of the fears of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They are taken away on the top of the waters. Their part of the earth is cursed. They do not go to their grape-fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dry weather and heat take away the water from the snow, just as the place of the dead takes away those who have sinned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A mother will forget him. The worm is pleased to eat him until he is remembered no more. Sin will be broken like a tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He does wrong to the woman who cannot give birth. And he does no good for the woman whose husband has died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God by His power gives long life to the strong. They rise again, even when they had no hope of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He makes them safe and gives them strength, and His eyes are on their ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are given honor for a little while, and then they are gone. They are brought low and gathered up as all others are. They are cut off like the heads of grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it is not so, who can prove me a liar, and show that what I say means nothing?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Bildad the Shuhite answered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Power and fear belong to God. He keeps peace in His high places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is there any number to His armies? Upon whom does His light not shine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How then can a man be right and good before God? How can he who is born of woman be clean?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, even the moon is not bright and the stars are not pure in His eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How much less man, who is a bug, and the son of man, who is a worm!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What a help you are to the weak! How you have saved the arm that has no strength!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How you have given wise words to him who has no wisdom! How much true learning you have given!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To whom have your words been said? And from whose spirit have you spoken?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The spirits of the dead shake under the waters and those living in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The place of the dead has no covering before God and the place that destroys has no covering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spreads out the north over empty waste, and hangs the earth on nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He holds the waters in His clouds, and the cloud does not break under them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He covers the face of the moon and spreads His cloud over it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has marked the sides around the waters where light and darkness are divided.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The pillars of heaven shake with fear. They are surprised and afraid of His sharp words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the sea quiet by His power. And by His understanding He destroyed Rahab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By His breath the heavens are made beautiful. His hand cut through the snake as it tried to get away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, these are only a few of the things He does. And how quiet are the words spoken about Him! But who can understand His powerful thunder?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Job kept on speaking, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As God lives, Who has taken away my right, and the All-powerful, Who has troubled my soul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as long as life is in me, and the breath of God is in my nose,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: my lips will not speak what is not true, and my tongue will not lie.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Far be it from me to say that you are right. Until I die I will not put away my honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I hold on to what is right and good and will not let it go. My heart does not put me to shame for any of my days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “May the one who hates me be as the sinful. And may the one who is against me be as those who are not right and good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what is the hope of the man without God when he dies, when God takes away his life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will God hear his cry when trouble comes upon him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will he be glad in the All-powerful? Will he call on God at all times?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will teach you about the power of God. I will not hide the ways of the All-powerful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of you have seen it yourselves. Why then do you speak in a foolish way?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what God gives to a sinful man, the gift that a man who makes it hard for others receives from the All-powerful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he has many sons, they will be killed by the sword. And his children will not have enough bread to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who are left to him will be buried because of disease. And the wives who have lost their husbands will not be able to cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He may gather up silver like dust, and gather so much clothing as if they were clay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He may have it, but those who are right with God will wear it. And those who are without guilt will divide the silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He builds his house like the home of a spider, or like a tent which a watchman has made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He goes to bed rich, but will never again. When he opens his eyes, his riches are gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fears come over him like a flood. A storm carries him away in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The east wind carries him away, and he is gone. It carries him away from his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It comes at him without pity. He tries to run from its power as fast as he can.
verses.speaker: Narrator
