verses.text: Men clap their hands at him, and drive him from his place with sounds of shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For sure there is a mine for silver, and a place where gold is made pure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Iron is taken out of the earth. And copper is melted from the rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Man looks into the deepest darkness. And he goes out to the farthest part of the earth to look for rocks in the dark places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men break open deep holes far from where people live, forgotten by travelers. In the holes they hang and move from side to side far from men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the earth, out of it comes food. But below, it is turned up as fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sapphires come from its rocks and its dust has gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No bird who eats meat knows that path. The falcon’s eye has not seen it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The proud animals have not stepped on it. The strong lion has not passed over it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Man puts his hand on the hard rock. He turns the mountains over at its base.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He makes a path through the rocks, and his eyes see everything of much worth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He stops rivers from flowing. And he brings to light what is hidden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But where can wisdom be found? And where is the place of understanding?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Man does not know its worth, and it is not found in the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The deep waters say, ‘It is not in me.’ The sea says, ‘It is not with me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pure gold cannot be traded for it and it cannot be bought with silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It cannot be compared in worth to the gold of Ophir, onyx of much worth, or sapphire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gold or glass cannot be compared to it in worth and it cannot be traded for objects of fine gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no need to say anything about coral or crystal because wisdom cannot be paid for with rubies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The topaz of Ethiopia cannot be compared to it in worth and it cannot be compared with the worth of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where then does wisdom come from? Where is the place of understanding?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is hidden from the eyes of all living. It is hidden from the birds of the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Place That Destroys and Death say, ‘We have only heard about it with our ears.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “God understands the way to wisdom, and He knows its place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He looks to the ends of the earth, and sees everything under the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave weight to the wind. He decided how much water would be in the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He decided how much rain would fall, and the path for the lightning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He saw wisdom and made it known. He made it last, and found out all about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to man, ‘See, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom. And to turn away from sin is understanding.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job spoke again and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If only I could be now as I was in the months past when God watched over me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His lamp shined over my head then and by His light I walked through darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those days were my best days when God was my friend watching over my tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The All-powerful was still with me, and my children were around me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My path was washed with milk, and the rock poured out rivers of oil for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I went to the city gate and took my place with the leaders of the city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the young men saw me and let me go by. The old men rose and stood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leaders stopped talking, and put their hands on their mouths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The voices of the rulers were quiet. Their tongues held to the roof of their mouths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who heard me, honored me. Those who saw me, respected me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I helped the poor man when he cried for help and the child without parents who had no one to help him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Good came to me from the man who was dying. And I made the heart of the woman whose husband had died sing for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I put on what was right and good, and it clothed me. The right things done were my coat and head-covering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was eyes to the blind, and feet to the man who could not walk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was a father to those in need. And I helped those I did not know who had a need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I broke the jaws of the sinful, and took from their teeth what they had taken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I thought, ‘I will die in my nest. My days will be as many as the sand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My roots go to the water. As the water is on the grass in the early morning, it will be all night on my branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My honor is always new to me, and my bow is new in my hand.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Men listened to me and waited. They were quiet so they could hear my words of wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After I spoke, they did not speak again. My words stayed with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They waited for me as for rain. And they opened their mouths as for the spring rain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I looked at them with joy when they were not sure of themselves, and the light of my face gave them comfort.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I decided the way for them and sat as their leader. I lived as a king among his army, and like one who gives comfort to those in sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But now those who are younger than I make fun of me. I thought so little of their fathers that I did not want them with my sheep dogs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, what good could I get from the strength of their hands? Their strength was gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their bodies are thin and in need of food. At night they bite the dry ground in the waste land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They pick plants that taste of salt among the bushes. And they eat the root of the broom bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are driven away from people. Men call out against them as if they were robbers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they live in valleys made by floods, in caves of the earth and of the rocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among the bushes they cry out. They gather together under the thistles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are fools and they have no name. They have been driven out of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now they make fun of me in song. They laugh at me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They hate me and keep away from me, but they spit in my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because God has made the string of my bow loose and has troubled me, they have thrown off their respect for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their bad group comes to my right. They push me away and trip my feet, and make ways to destroy me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They break up my path. They make trouble for me, and no one stops them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They come as if through a wide hole in the wall, and roll on with much noise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fears come upon me. They go after my honor like the wind. And my well-being has passed away like a cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now my soul is poured out within me. Days of trouble have taken hold of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Night cuts into my bones with pain. The pain keeps on and takes no rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My clothing is torn by a strong power. It pulls against me like the top of my coat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God has thrown me into the mud, and I have become like dust and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I cry out to You for help, but You do not answer me. I stand up, and You turn away from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You work against me. With the power of Your hand you make it hard for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You lift me up to the wind and make it carry me. You throw me around in the storm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know that You will bring me to death, to the place for all the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yet does not one in a destroyed place put out his hand, and in his trouble cry out for help?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have I not cried for the one whose life is hard? Was not my soul filled with sorrow for the poor?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I expected good, then trouble came. When I waited for light, darkness came.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My heart is troubled and does not rest. Days of trouble are before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I go about full of sorrow without comfort. I stand up where the people are gathered and cry out for help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have become a brother to wild dogs, and a friend of ostriches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My skin becomes black and falls from me. My bones burn because I am sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So my harp is turned to sorrow, and my horn to the sound of crying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have made an agreement with my eyes not to look with desire at a young woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What would be my share from God above? What would my gift be from the All-powerful on high?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does not trouble come to those who are not right and good? Do not hard times come to those who do wrong?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does He not see my ways and number all my steps?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If I have walked in ways that are false, and my foot has been quick to follow false ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let Him weigh me with a true weight. Let God know that I am honest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If my step has turned from the way, and my heart has followed my eyes, or if my hands have held on to sin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then let me plant and another eat. Let what grows be pulled out by the roots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If my heart has been tempted by a woman, or I have waited at my neighbor’s door,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: may my wife grind grain for another. And let others bow down upon her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For that would be a very sinful thing to do. It would be a sin that would be punished by the judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For that would be a fire that burns at the Place That Destroys. It would dig out all I have planted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If I did not listen to my men servants and women servants when they complained against me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: what will I do when God speaks to me? When He asks me why, what will I answer Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did not He Who made me inside my mother make him also? Did not the same One give us life from our mothers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If I have kept what the poor should have or have caused the eyes of the woman whose husband has died to be tired,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if I have eaten my food alone without sharing it with the child who has no parents,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (but from the time I was young, he grew up with me as a father, and I have helped the woman without a husband since I was born,)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if I have seen anyone die because he had no clothing, or left any poor person without clothes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if he has not thanked me for the clothing on his body, and been made warm with the wool of my sheep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if I have not done these things, or if I have lifted up my hand against the child who has no parents, because I saw I had help in the gate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let my shoulder fall out of place, and let my arm be broken off at the joint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For trouble sent by God fills me with fear. Because of His great power I could not do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If I have put my faith in gold and said fine gold is my trust,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if I have had pride because of my many riches and have received much by my hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if I have looked at the sun shining or the bright moon going on its way,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and have in secret worshiped them in my heart, and have honored them by throwing them a kiss with my hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: these also would be sins to be judged. It would say I did not know the God above.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Have I been glad when a person who hated me was destroyed? Have I been filled with joy when trouble came to him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No, I have not allowed my mouth to sin by asking his life to be cursed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have the men of my tent not said, ‘Who can find one who has not been filled with his meat’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The stranger has not stayed in the street, for I have opened my doors to the traveler.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have I hidden my sins like Adam? Have I hidden my wrong-doing in my heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I was afraid of all the people, and of families who hated me? Did I keep quiet and not go out of the door?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If only I had one to hear me! See, here my name is written. Let the All-powerful answer me! May what is against me be written down!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure I would carry it on my shoulder. I would tie it around my head like a crown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I would tell Him the number of my every step. I would come near Him like a prince.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If my land cries out against me and the ditches made by the plow cry together,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if I have eaten its fruit without paying for it, and caused its owners to die,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
let thorns grow instead of grain. And let weeds with a bad smell grow instead of barley.”
The words of Job are finished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then these three men stopped answering Job, because he was right and good in his own eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the family of Ram, became very angry. He was angry at Job because he said he was right with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was angry at his three friends because they had found no answer, yet they had said that Job was wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Elihu had waited to speak to Job because they were older than he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of the three men, he was very angry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite said, “I am young, and you are old. So I did not feel that I should speak. I was afraid to tell you what I think.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thought the older men should speak, and that the many years should teach wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it is the spirit in a man and the breath of the All-powerful that gives him understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The old may not be wise. They may not understand what is right and fair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I say, ‘Listen to me. I also will tell you what I think.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, I waited for your words. I listened to what you said and waited to hear more from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was careful to listen to you. There was no one who could prove that Job was wrong. None of you could answer his words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not say, ‘We have found wisdom. God will show he is wrong, not man.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Job has not spoken his words against me. And I will not answer him with your words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They are troubled and have no more to say. Words do not come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should I wait because they do not speak, because they stand there and do not answer?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also will give my answer. I will tell what I think.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am full of words. The spirit within me makes me speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, my stomach is like wine that cannot get out. It is ready to break like new wine bottles made of skin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let me speak, that I may find comfort. Let me open my lips and answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will not show favor to anyone, or praise any man in a false way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I do not know how to say sweet-sounding words that are not true, for then my Maker would soon take me away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But now, Job, hear what I say. Listen to all my words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I open my mouth. My tongue in my mouth wants to speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My words come from my heart that is right. My lips speak in truth what I know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit of God has made me. And the breath of the All-powerful gives me life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Prove me wrong if you can. Get ready to answer me, and take your stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I belong to God like you. I also have been made from the clay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, you have no reason to be afraid of me. I should not make it hard for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For sure you have spoken in my hearing. I have heard all you have said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You said, ‘I am pure and without sin. I am not guilty, and there is no sin in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But see, God finds things against me. He thinks of me as someone who hates Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He puts my feet in chains, and watches all my paths.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I tell you, in this you are not right. For God is greater than man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do you complain against Him? He does not give a reason for all He does.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God speaks once, or twice, and yet no one listens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In a dream, a special dream of the night, when deep sleep comes upon men, while they sleep in their beds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then He opens the ears of men. He teaches them and makes them afraid telling them of danger,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that He may turn man away from wrong-doing and keep him from pride.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He keeps his soul from going to the place of the dead. And He keeps his life from being destroyed by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Man is also punished with pain on his bed and has pain all the time in his bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he hates bread, and has no desire for fine foods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His flesh is so wasted away that it cannot be seen. His bones which were not seen stick out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His soul comes close to the grave, and his life to those who bring death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If there is an angel, one out of a thousand, to speak with God for him, and to show a man what is right for him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then let him be kind to him, and say, ‘Save him from going down to the grave. I have found someone to pay the price to make him free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let his flesh become young again. Let him return to the days when he was young and strong.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he will pray to God, and God will be pleased with him. He will see His face with joy. And God will make man right with Him again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will sing to men and say, ‘I have sinned and have not done what is right, but He did not punish me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has kept my soul from going to the grave. And my life will see the light.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, God does all these things twice, even three times, to a man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to turn back his soul from the grave, that he may see the light of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear what I say, O Job, listen to me. Be quiet and let me speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you have anything to say, answer me. Speak, for I want to make you right with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If not, listen to me. Be quiet, and I will teach you wisdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elihu said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hear my words, you wise men. Listen to me, you who know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the ear tests words as the mouth tastes food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us choose for ourselves what is right. Let us know among ourselves what is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Job has said, ‘I am right and good, but God has taken away my right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Would I lie about my right? I have been hurt so that I cannot be healed, but I have done no wrong.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What man is like Job, who drinks up words against him like water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He goes among those who do wrong, and walks with sinful men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he has said, ‘A man gets nothing by trying to please God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So listen to me, you men of understanding. Far be it from God to do what is sinful, and from the All-powerful to do wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He pays a man by the work he does. He will see that a man is paid for what he does.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure God will not do wrong. The All-powerful will not turn what is right into sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who gave Him the power over the earth? Who gave Him the whole world to take care of?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If He should take back His spirit and His breath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all flesh would die together, and man would return to dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you have understanding, hear this. Listen to what I say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should one who hates what is right be the one to rule? Will you say that He Who is right and good and strong is guilty?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who says to a king, ‘You are of no worth,’ and to rulers, ‘You are sinful’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who shows no favor to princes, or thinks of the rich as more important than the poor? They are all the work of His hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In a short time they die. At midnight the people are shaken and pass away. And the powerful are taken away by no human hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For God’s eyes are upon the ways of a man, and He sees all his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no darkness or shadow where sinners can hide themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God does not need to set a time for man to go before Him and be judged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He breaks powerful men in pieces without asking any reason, and puts others in their place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He knows their works. He puts them down in the night, and they are crushed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God punishes them for their sin where everyone can see them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because they turned aside from following Him. They did not care about any of His ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they caused the cry of the poor to come to Him. And He heard the cry of those in need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He keeps quiet, who can say He is wrong? When He hides His face, who can see Him? But He is over both nation and man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So men without God should not rule and should not be a trap for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For has any one said to God, ‘I have suffered punishment, and will not cause any more trouble?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Teach me what I cannot see. If I have sinned, I will do it no more’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will God ask what you want to do, when you will not do what He says? You must decide, and not I. So tell what you know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men of understanding will say to me, and wise men who hear me say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Job speaks without much learning. His words are without wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Job should be tried to the end, because he answers like sinful men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To his sin he adds a strong will against God. Making fun he claps his hands among us, and speaks many words against God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elihu said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do you think this is right? Do you say, ‘I am more right than God’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you ask, ‘What will You get by it? How will it be better for me than if I had sinned?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will answer you, and your friends with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look at the heavens and see. See the clouds which are higher than you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you have sinned, what does that do to God? If you have done many wrongs, what does that do to Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you are right and good, what do you give to Him? What does He receive from you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your wrong-doing may hurt another man and your being right and good may help him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “People cry out because of their many hard times. They cry for help because of the arm of the powerful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But no one says, ‘Where is God my Maker, Who gives songs in the night,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who teaches us more than the animals of the earth, and makes us wiser than the birds of the heavens?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There they cry out, but He does not answer because of the pride of sinful men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure God will not listen to an empty cry. The All-powerful will not do anything about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How much less when you say you do not see Him, that your trial is before Him, and you must wait for Him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, because God has not punished in His anger, and does not watch for sin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Job opens his mouth with empty talk. He speaks many words without much learning.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elihu spoke more and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Wait for me a little longer, and I will show you that there is yet more to be said for God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I bring my learning from far away, and will tell how right and good my Maker is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure my words are not false. One who is perfect in much learning is with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, God is powerful, but does not hate anyone. He is powerful in strength of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He does not keep the sinful alive, but gives what is right and fair to those who are troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He does not turn His eyes away from those who are right with Him. He puts them on the throne with kings and they are honored forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they are tied up in chains and caught in the ropes of trouble,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then He makes known to them their work and their sins, that they have shown pride.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He makes them listen to teaching, and tells them to turn away from sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they hear and serve Him, the rest of their days will be filled with what they need and their years with peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they do not hear, they will die by the sword. They will die without learning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But those who do not know God keep anger in their heart. They do not cry for help when He puts them in chains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They die when they are young. And their life ends among those who sell the use of their bodies in the houses of the false gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He takes those who suffer out of their suffering. He speaks to them in times of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He led you from being close to trouble to a wide place where you were free with your table full of food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But you wanted to punish the sinful. Punishment and being fair have taken hold of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful or anger will tempt you to laugh at the truth. Do not take pay in secret for wrong-doing and be turned aside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will your riches or all your power keep you from trouble?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not desire the night, when people are taken from their place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful, do not turn to sin. For you have chosen this instead of suffering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, God is honored in His power. Who is a teacher like Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who has told Him the way He should go? And who has said, ‘You have done wrong’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Remember that you should honor His work, of which men have sung.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All men have seen it. Man sees it from far away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, God is honored, and we do not know Him. We are not able to know the number of His years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He takes up the drops of water that become rain,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which the clouds pour down. Much rain falls on man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can anyone understand how the clouds are spread out, or how He thunders from His tent?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, He spreads His lightning around Him and covers the bottom of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by these He judges the people and He gives much food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He covers His hands with the lightning, and tells it to hit the mark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His thunder tells of a storm coming, and cattle also know it is coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At this my heart shakes with fear and jumps from its place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen to the thunder of His voice and the noise that comes from His mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He lets it loose under the whole heaven. He lets His lightning go to the ends of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His voice sounds after it. He thunders with His great and powerful voice. And He does not hold back the lightning when His voice is heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God thunders with His great voice. He does great things which we cannot understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He says to the snow, ‘Fall on the earth,’ and to the rain, ‘Be strong.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He stops the work of every man, that all men may know His work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the wild animals go to their holes, and stay where they live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The storm comes from the south, and the cold from the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Water becomes ice by the breath of God. The wide waters become ice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He loads the heavy clouds with water and they send out His lightning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It changes its path and turns around by His leading, doing whatever He tells it to do on the earth where people live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He causes it to happen for punishment, or for His world, or because of His love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hear this, O Job. Stop and think about the great works of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you know how God does them, and makes the lightning shine from His cloud?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you know how the clouds are set in heaven, the great works of Him Who is perfect in understanding?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you know why you are hot in your clothes when the land becomes quiet because of the south wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can you help Him spread out the sky, making it as hard as a mirror made from heated brass?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Teach us what we should say to Him. We cannot put words together to help us because of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should He be told that I want to speak? Did a man ever wish to be swallowed up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now men cannot look on the light when it is bright in the sky, when the wind has passed and made it clear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A bright gold light is seen in the north. Around God is great power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We cannot come near the All-powerful. He is lifted high with power. And He is right and fair and good and will not make it hard for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So men honor Him with fear. He has respect for any who are wise in heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord answered Job out of the strong wind and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Who is this that makes words of wisdom dark by speaking without much learning?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now get ready like a man, and I will ask you some questions and you answer Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where were you when I began building the earth? Tell Me, if you have understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who decided how big it was to be, since you know? Who looked to see if it was as big as it should be?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What was it built upon? Who laid its first stone,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when the morning stars sang together and all the sons of God called out for joy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Who shut up the sea with doors, when it rushed out from its secret place?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I made clouds its clothing, and put much darkness around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I marked the places where it could not pass, and set locks and doors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I said, ‘You will come this far, and no farther. Here will your proud waves stop.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Have you ever in your life told the morning when to come, and caused the first light of day to know its place,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that it might take hold of the ends of the earth, and the sinful be shaken out of it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is changed like clay when an object is pushed down to mark it, and they stand out like clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The light of the sinful is held back, and the arm lifted up is broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Have you gone into the wells of the sea? Have you walked on the bottom of the deep sea?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have the gates of death been shown to you? Or have you seen the gates of the deep darkness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have you understood how great the earth is? Tell Me, if you know all this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Where does the light come from? And where is the place of darkness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you may take it to its land, and know the paths to its home?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know, for you were born then. You are very old!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have you gone into the store-houses of the snow? Have you seen the store-houses of the hail,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which I have kept for the time of trouble, for the day of war and battle?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is the way to the place where the light is divided, or the east wind spread over the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Who has cut open a way for the flood, and a path for the thunderstorm?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who brings rain on the land without people, on a desert without a man in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to fill the need of the wasted land, and to make the grass grow?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does the rain have a father? Who has given birth to the drops of rain?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who gave birth to ice? And who gave birth to the snow water of heaven?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Water becomes hard like stone, and the top of the sea is covered with ice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Can you tie the chains of the stars of Pleiades, or loose the ropes of Orion?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can you lead the groups of stars out at the right times? Can you lead the stars of the Bear with her young?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you know the laws of the heavens? Can you make them to rule over the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Can you lift up your voice to the clouds, that a flood of water may cover you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can you send out lightnings, that they may go and say to you, ‘Here we are’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who has given wisdom to the heart? Who has given understanding to the mind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who can number the clouds by wisdom? Or who can push over the water jars of the heavens,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when the dust gathers together and becomes hard?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Can you hunt food for the lion? Can you fill the hunger of the young lions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when they lie in their own place in the rock, or wait in their hiding place?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who gets the food ready for the raven, when its young cry to God and go about without food?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do you know when the mountain goats give birth? Do you watch the deer giving birth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can you number the months that they carry their young? Or do you know the time when their young are born?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They get down and give birth to their young, and get rid of their pains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their young ones become strong. They grow up in the open field. They leave and do not return to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Who has let the wild donkey go free? Who has taken off the ropes which held the fast donkey?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave him the desert for a home, and the salt land for a place to live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hates the noise of the city. He does not hear the calls of the man who drives him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He goes looking for grass to eat on the mountains. He looks for every green thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will the wild ox be willing to serve you? Will he stay through the night by the food you give him to eat?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can you tie the wild ox to a plow in the field? Will he follow you to plow the valleys?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will you trust in him because he is very strong, and leave your work to him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will you trust him to return and bring your grain to your grain-floor?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The wings of the ostrich wave with joy, but are they the wings of love?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For she leaves her eggs to the earth and lets them get warm in the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She forgets that a foot might crush them, or that the wild animal may step on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She is bad in the way she acts toward her young, as if they were not hers. Her work of giving birth is for nothing, for she does not care.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because God has not given her wisdom or her share of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she begins to run, she laughs at the horse and the horseman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do you give the horse his strength? Do you dress his neck with long hair?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you make him jump like the locust? The powerful noise he makes with his nostrils fills men with fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hits his foot against the ground in the valley, and has joy in his strength. He goes out to meet the battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He laughs at fear and is not afraid. He does not turn back from the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The arrows and spears he carries make noise as they hit together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He runs fast over the ground with shaking and anger. He cannot stand still at the sound of the horn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the horn sounds, he laughs without fear. He smells the battle from far away. He hears the thunder of the captains, and the war cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Is it by your understanding that the hawk flies, spreading his wings toward the south?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it because the eagle is obeying you that he flies high and makes his nest in a high place?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He lives on a high rock. His strong place is on the mountain-top that is hard to reach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there he looks for his food. His eyes see it from far away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is where dead bodies are and his young ones drink the blood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Job,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Will one who finds fault not agree with the All-powerful? He who speaks strong words against God, let him answer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Job answered the Lord and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, I am not important. What can I answer You? I put my hand on my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have spoken once, and I cannot answer; even twice, and I have no more to say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord answered out of the storm, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Get ready like a man. I will ask you, and you answer Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will you say what I decide is wrong? Will you say that I have done wrong, that you may be made right?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you have an arm like God? Can you thunder with a voice like His?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Dress yourself with shining-greatness and great power. Cover yourself with honor and greatness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pour out your anger that is flowing over. Look on everyone who is proud, and put him to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look on everyone who is proud, and bring him down. Crush the sinful where they stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hide them all in the dust together. Shut them up in the hidden place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will also tell you that your own right hand can save you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See now the hippopotamus, which I made as well as you. He eats grass like an ox.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, his strength is in his body. His power is in his stomach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He moves his tail like a cedar tree. His legs are made very strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His bones are like brass. His legs are like pieces of iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He is the first of the works of God. Let his maker bring him his sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure the mountains bring food to him where all the animals of the field play.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He lies down under the lotus plants, hidden in the high river grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He lies in the shadow of the lotus plants, with the willow trees of the river around him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a river flows over, he is not afraid. He is sure of himself even if the Jordan rushes against his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can anyone take him when he is watching? Can anyone catch him and put a ring in his nose?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Can you pull the crocodile out with a fish-hook? Can you tie his tongue down with a rope?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can you put a rope in his nose, or put a hook through his jaw?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will he beg you to be good to him? Will he speak soft words to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will he make an agreement with you to take him and make him your servant forever?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will you play with him as if he were a bird? Or will you put him on a rope for your young women?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will traders talk about buying and selling him? Will they divide him among the store-keepers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can you fill his skin or his head with fish spears?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lay your hand on him, and remember the battle. You will not do it again!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, the hope of man is false. One is laid low even when seeing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one is so powerful that he would wake him. Who then can stand before Me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who has given Me everything, that I should pay him back? Whatever is under the whole heaven is Mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will not keep quiet about his legs, or his powerful strength, or the good way he is made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who can take off his outside clothing? Who can get through his hard skin?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who can open the doors of his mouth? Around his teeth is much fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His hard covering is his pride. He is shut up as with a lock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One piece of his hard skin is so close to another that no air can come between them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are joined one to another. They hold on to each other and cannot be separated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His breath gives out light. And his eyes are like those of the first light of day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Burning light goes out of his mouth. Fire comes out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Smoke goes out of his nostrils, as from a boiling pot and burning grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His breath sets fire to coals. A fire goes out of his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Strength is in his neck, and fear jumps in front of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The folds of his flesh are joined together. They are set in place and cannot be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His heart is as hard as a stone, even as hard as a grinding-stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he raises himself up, the powerful are afraid. They are troubled because of his noise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sword that hits him cannot cut. And spears are of no use.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He thinks of iron as straw, and brass as soft wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The arrow cannot make him run away. Stones thrown at him are like dry grass to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He thinks of heavy sticks as dry grass. He laughs at the noise of the spear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The parts under him are like sharp pieces of a pot. He spreads out like a grain crusher on the mud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He makes the sea boil like a pot. He makes the sea like a jar of oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He makes his way shine behind him. One would think that the sea has white hair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nothing on earth is like him, one made without fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looks on everything that is high. He is king over all that are proud.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered the Lord, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I know that You can do all things. Nothing can put a stop to Your plans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Who is this that hides words of wisdom without much learning?’ I have said things that I did not understand, things too great for me, which I did not know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Hear now, and I will speak. I will ask you, and you answer Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I had heard of You only by the hearing of the ear, but now my eye sees You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I hate the things that I have said. And I put dust and ashes on myself to show how sorry I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the Lord had spoken these words to Job, the Lord said to Eliphaz the Temanite, “My anger burns against you and your two friends, because you have not spoken of Me what is right, as My servant Job has.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now take seven bulls and seven rams, and go to My servant Job. Give a burnt gift for yourselves, and My servant Job will pray for you. For I will hear his prayer and not punish you for being foolish, because you have not spoken of Me what is right, as My servant Job has.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Eliphaz the Temanite, Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite, did what the Lord told them. And the Lord heard Job’s prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord returned to Job all the things that he had lost, when he prayed for his friends. The Lord gave Job twice as much as he had before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all his brothers and sisters and all who had known him before came to him, and ate bread with him in his house. They showed pity and comforted him for all the trouble the Lord had brought upon him. Each one gave him one piece of money and a gold ring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord brought more good to Job in his later years than in his beginning. He had 14,000 sheep, 6,000 camels, 2,000 oxen, and 1,000 female donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had seven sons and three daughters also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave the first the name Jemimah, the second Keziah, and the third Keren-happuch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No women were found in all the land who were as beautiful as Job’s daughters. And their father gave them a share among their brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this Job lived 140 years, and saw his sons, his grandsons, and even their sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job died, an old man having lived many days.
verses.speaker: Narrator
